isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - IC BUS - BUS CAB ACCESSORIES - DESCRIPTION

svcsubproc.title: Dual Horn
svcsubproc.para: The dual electric horns (high and low note), located on the front engine mounting crossmember, provide a means for the driver to signal or provide warning.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signals
svcsubproc.para: Turn signals provide a driver with the means to signal, oncoming traffic or following vehicles, of intended turns or lane changes. The turn signal switch is mounted in the stationary steering column or the tilt steering column.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signals With Dual Face Lights
svcsubproc.para: Turn signals provide a driver with the means to signal, oncoming traffic or following vehicles, of intended turns or lane changes. The turn signal switch is mounted in the stationary steering column or the tilt steering column. The optional dual face lamps are mounted on top of the front fenders and provide additional signaling.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signals With Stationary Steering Column And With Separate T/S Flasher
svcsubproc.para: Turn signals provide a driver with the means to signal, oncoming traffic or following vehicles, of intended turns or lane changes. The turn signal switch is mounted in the stationary steering column. Turn signals with the optional separate T/S flasher, provides a driver with two flashers, one for turn signal flashing from the key switch IGN power terminal and the other for hazard flashing from the battery power fuse. The optional dual face lamps are mounted on top of the front fenders and provide additional signaling.
